intro: Malnerega, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in soft, grayish-green foliage. Its most striking feature is the clusters of tiny, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Malnerega is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive, mist-like appearance.
